<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" ><tr><td valign="top" style="font: inherit;"><DIV>w. I just finished a couple hour review of the web site you sent for Sandra Belanger at <A href="http://www.heliumraven.com/home">http://www.heliumraven.com/home</A>    Man did that answer a lot of questions I had about how this technology can work with mediumship/spiritualism.  Also renewed my hope in working with evpmaker.  The case history that Sandra recounts on the site should be a "must read" for anyone serious about evp.itc.  I would like to understand more about the relationship between evp and mediumship.  Does a "good" evper need to be a "sensitive" or medium or does it just give someone with the sensitivity the edge over someone else?  Even Sandra now says that she had a certain amount of "sensitivity" before she started using evp technology and that now she actually "communicates directly" with
 spirit.  To me that means she is a medium....no?</DIV>
<DIV> </DIV>
<DIV>Also, regarding the Fish Group...I was taken back to read on her website that The Fish Group was helpful in having her "solve" the Lacy Peterson case.   Chalk a good deed up to The Fish Group.   Thanks for the web site.  Ron l<BR><BR>--- On <B>Mon, 8/18/08, black bear hollow <I><blackbearhollow@...></I></B> wrote:<BR></DIV>
<BLOCKQUOTE style="PADDING-LEFT: 5px; MARGIN-LEFT: 5px; BORDER-LEFT: rgb(16,16,255) 2px solid">From: black bear hollow <blackbearhollow@...><BR>Subject: Re: [<SPAN>EVP</SPAN>-ITC] Ahhh the infamous Fish!<BR>To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com<BR>Date: Monday, August 18, 2008, 9:23 AM<BR><BR>
<DIV id=yiv702790929>
<DIV id=ygrp-text>
<DIV>I'd love to hear about it Zack. Love that stuff.  
<DIV><BR></DIV>
<DIV>w.<BR>
<DIV>
<DIV>On Aug 18, 2008, at 11:23 AM, Zack Widup wrote:</DIV><BR class=Apple-interchange-newline>
<BLOCKQUOTE type="cite"><SPAN class=Apple-style-span style="FONT-WEIGHT: normal; FONT-SIZE: 13px; COLOR: rgb(0,0,0); TEXT-INDENT: 0px; FONT-STYLE: normal; FONT-FAMILY: Georgia; LETTER-SPACING: normal; BORDER-COLLAPSE: separate; FONT-VARIANT: normal">I could go into that quite a bit, having studied quantum electrodynamics<SPAN class=Apple-converted-space> </SPAN><BR>extensively. But everything - matter, light, all forms of energy, etc.<SPAN class=Apple-converted-space> </SPAN><BR>all break down to ... motion. It just builds into more complicated schemes<SPAN class=Apple-converted-space> </SPAN><BR>and becomes light, sound, radio waves, coffee cups and coffee, etc.<BR>:-)<BR><BR>Zack</SPAN></BLOCKQUOTE></DIV><BR></DIV></DIV></DIV></BLOCKQUOTE></td></tr></table><br>
